intro: Gouania timorensis, commonly known as the Timor gouania, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically white or pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
